thread.title: Parkland quarterback Devante Cross verbally commits to Boston College
thread.title_full: Parkland quarterback Devante Cross verbally commits to Boston College

title: Parkland quarterback Devante Cross verbally commits to Boston College
text:
Parkland quarterback Devante Cross runs the ball against Liberty. (Sue Beyer | For lehighvalleylive.com) By Greg Joyce | For lehighvalleylive.com on October 16, 2015 12:02 PM, updated October 16, 2015 12:12 PM 
Hours before one of Parkland 's biggest games of the regular season Friday night against Easton, its senior quarterback Devante Cross took one big decision off his shoulders. 
The three-year starter gave a verbal commitment to continue his academic and football career at Boston College. Proud to announce that I've committed to Boston College to continue my academic and football career. pic.twitter.com/7UQG8DxwV5 â€” Kid Bread (@_DCross_11) October 16, 2015 
Through six games this season, Cross is 85-for-135 passing for 1,211 yards and 10 touchdowns while adding 74 carries for 475 yards and 11 touchdowns. For his career, he is 336 of 585 passing for 4,614 yards and 48 touchdowns, all of which are school records. 
RELATED : Year of the QB: Parkland's Devante Cross, The Blue Chipper 
Cross has also been playing cornerback this year for the Trojans. 
The 6-foot-2, 185-pounder had multiple Division I offers in football and basketball. His football offers included BC, Syracuse and Villanova while his basketball offers featured Holy Cross and George Mason. 
The last Parkland football player to head to Chestnut Hill found great success, as running back Andre Williams became a Heisman Trophy finalist and now plays for the New York Giants.
